content.question: A box of mass <math alttext="0.5 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.5</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>kg</mtext></math> with a fan attached to its top is moving to the right when it reaches a ramp, as shown. As the box slides up the ramp a distance of <math alttext="4.0 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4.0</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>m</mtext></math>, the fan exerts a <math alttext="0.5 newton" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.5</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>N</mtext></math> force opposite the direction of the box’s motion. The box momentarily comes to rest at the top of the ramp, at a height of <math alttext="1.0 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.0</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>m</mtext></math> above its starting point. There is negligible friction between the box and the ramp. What is the total work done on the box as it slides up the ramp?
